<line: 32> ) 
<line: 33> Defendants.  
<line: 34> ) 

[TITLE]
<line: 36> ANSWER TO PLAINTIFFS’ AMENDED COMPLAINT AT LAW  

[TEXT]
<line: 38> Defendants, PETER J. DiANGI, Individually and as Employee or agent of Silver Lake 
<line: 39> Country Club, Inc. and SILVER LAKE COUNTRY CLUB, INC., by and through their 
<line: 40> attorneys, WILSON, ELSER, MOSKOWITZ, EDELMAN & DICKER LLP and for their 
<line: 41> Answer to Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law, state as follows: 

[TITLE]
<line: 43> COMMON FACTUAL ALLEGATIONS 

[TEXT]
<line: 45> 1. 
<line: 46> At all times relevant herein, the Plaintiffs, ANDREW TERRELL and GEORGE 

[TEXT]
<line: 48> TERRELL were residents of the County of Cook and State of Illinois. 

[TEXT]
<line: 50> ANSWER: 
<line: 51> Defendant has insufficient knowledge with which to form a belief as to the truth 
<line: 52> or falsity of the allegations contained in Paragraph 1 of Plaintiffs’ Amended 
<line: 53> Complaint at Law, and, therefore, neither admits nor denies said allegations, but 
<line: 54> demands strict proof thereof. 

[TEXT]
<line: 56> 2. 
<line: 57> At all times relevant herein, the Defendant, PETER DiANGI, was a resident of 

[TEXT]
<line: 59> the County of Cook and State of Illinois. 

[TEXT]
<line: 61> ANSWER: 
<line: 62> Defendant, Peter DiAngi, admits the allegations contained in Paragraph 2 of 
<line: 63> Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law. 

[ABANDON]
<line: 65> 504739.1 

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430     Document 28      Filed 07/18/2008     Page 2 of 34

[TEXT]
<line: 4> 3. 
<line: 5> At all times relevant herein, the Defendant, PETER DiANGI, was employed by 
<line: 6> the Defendant, SILVER LAKE, as a security guard. 

[TITLE]
<line: 8> ANSWER: 
<line: 9> Defendants, admit only that Peter DiAngi was employed by the Defendant, Silver 
<line: 10> Lake, as a security guard on the date of the incident alleged in Plaintiffs’ 
<line: 11> Amended Complaint at Law.  Further answering, Defendants have insufficient 
<line: 12> knowledge with which to form a belief as to the truth or falsity of the remaining 
<line: 13> allegations contained in Paragraph 3 of Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law, 
<line: 14> and, therefore, neither admits nor denies said allegations, but demands strict proof 
<line: 15> thereof. 

[TEXT]
<line: 17> 4. 
<line: 18> At all times relevant herein, the Defendant, PETER DiANGI, was employed by 

[TEXT]
<line: 20> the Defendant, ORLAND PARK, as a police officer. 

[TEXT]
<line: 22> ANSWER: 
<line: 23> Defendant, Peter DiAngi, individually and as employee of Silver Lake Country 
<line: 24> Club, Inc., states that the allegations set forth in Paragraph 4 are conclusions of 
<line: 25> law or a fact and therefore require no answer.  Further answering, to the extent 
<line: 26> any factual allegations are alleged, Defendants, Peter DiAngi, individually and as 
<line: 27> employee of Silver Lake Country Club, Inc., deny such allegations.  

[TEXT]
<line: 29> 5. 
<line: 30> At all times relevant herein, the Defendant, SILVER LAKE, was a duly licensed 
<line: 31> corporation, incorporated in the State of Illinois and doing business as Silver Lake Country Club 
<line: 32> and located at 14700 South 82nd Avenue in the City of Orland Park, County of Cook, and State 
<line: 33> of Illinois. 

[TITLE]
<line: 35> ANSWER: 
<line: 36> Defendant, Silver Lake, admits the allegations contained in Paragraph 5 of 
<line: 37> Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law.  Further answering, Defendants, Peter 
<line: 38> DiAngi, individually and as employee of Silver Lake Country Club, Inc., have 
<line: 39> insufficient knowledge with which to form a belief as to the truth or falsity of the 
<line: 40> remaining allegations contained in Paragraph 5 of Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint 
<line: 41> at Law, and, therefore, neither admits nor denies said allegations, but demands 
<line: 42> strict proof thereof. 

[TEXT]
<line: 44> 6. 
<line: 45> On or about March 18, 2006, the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, and his fiancé 
<line: 46> were married at Queen of Martyrs Church in Evergreen Park. Immediately after the wedding 
<line: 47> ceremony, the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, his fiancé, and various other members of the 

[ABANDON]
<line: 49> 2

[ABANDON]
<line: 51> 504739.1 

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430     Document 28      Filed 07/18/2008     Page 3 of 34

[TEXT]
<line: 4> wedding guests, including Plaintiff GEORGE TERRELL, attended a wedding reception at Silver 
<line: 5> Lake Country Club. 

[TEXT]
<line: 7> ANSWER: 
<line: 8> Defendants admit only that Andrew Terrell, his fiancé and George Terrell 
<line: 9> attended a wedding reception at Silver Lake Country Club on or about March 18, 
<line: 10> 2006.  Further answering, Defendants have insufficient knowledge with which to 
<line: 11> form a belief as to the truth or falsity of the allegations contained in Paragraph 6 
<line: 12> of Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law, and, therefore, neither admits nor 
<line: 13> denies said allegations, but demands strict proof thereof. 

[TEXT]
<line: 15> 7. 
<line: 16> The Defendant, PETER DiANGI, grabbed the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, 
<line: 17> by the arm. 

[TEXT]
<line: 19> ANSWER: 
<line: 20> Defendants deny the allegations contained in Paragraph 7 of Plaintiffs’ Amended 
<line: 21> Complaint at Law. 

[TEXT]
<line: 23> 8. 
<line: 24> Prior to (sic) grabbing the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, the Defendant, 
<line: 25> PETER DiANGI, did not identify himself as security guard or other employee of SILVER 
<line: 26> LAKE, nor did he identify himself as a police officer. 

[TEXT]
<line: 28> ANSWER: 
<line: 29> Defendants deny the allegations contained in Paragraph 8 of Plaintiffs’ Amended 
<line: 30> Complaint at Law. 
<line: 31> 9. 
<line: 32> Subsequent to grabbing the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, the Defendant, 

[TEXT]
<line: 34> PETER DiANGI, grabbed ANDREW TERRELL by the neck.  A melee ensued as wedding 
<line: 35> guests attempted to defend the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL. 

[TEXT]
<line: 37> ANSWER: 
<line: 38> Defendants deny the allegations contained in Paragraph 9 of Plaintiffs’ Amended 
<line: 39> Complaint at Law. 

[TEXT]
<line: 41> 10. 
<line: 42> At all relevant times, the Defendant, PETER DiANGI, was dressed in “plain 
<line: 43> clothes”, and was not wearing a police uniform. 

[TEXT]
<line: 45> ANSWER: 
<line: 46> Defendant admits the allegations contained in Paragraph 8 of Plaintiffs’ Amended 
<line: 47> Complaint at Law.  

[TEXT]
<line: 49> 11. 
<line: 50> As a result of the aforesaid melee, the Plaintiffs, ANDREW TERRELL, and 
<line: 51> GEORGE TERRELL, were arrested and charged with battery. 

[ABANDON]
<line: 53> 3

[ABANDON]
<line: 55> 504739.1 

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430     Document 28      Filed 07/18/2008     Page 4 of 34

[TITLE]
<line: 4> ANSWER: 
<line: 5> Defendants admit, upon information and belief, that Andrew Terrell and George 
<line: 6> Terrell were arrested and charged with battery.  Further answering, Defendants 
<line: 7> deny the remainder of the allegations contained in Paragraph 11 of Plaintiffs’ 
<line: 8> Amended Complaint at Law. 

[TEXT]
<line: 10> 12. 
<line: 11> The arrests of the Plaintiff were made under false pretenses, given that the 
<line: 12> Defendant, PETER DiANGI, instigated the events leading to the aforesaid arrests. 

[TEXT]
<line: 14> ANSWER: 
<line: 15> Defendant, Peter DiAngi, individually and as employee of Silver Lake Country 
<line: 16> Club, Inc., denies the allegations contained in Paragraph 12 of Plaintiffs’ 
<line: 17> Amended Complaint at Law.  Further answering, Defendant, Silver Lake Country 
<line: 18> Club, has insufficient knowledge with which to form a belief as to the truth or 
<line: 19> falsity of the remaining allegations contained in Paragraph 12 of Plaintiffs’ 
<line: 20> Amended Complaint at Law, and, therefore, neither admits nor denies said 
<line: 21> allegations, but demands strict proof thereof. 

[TEXT]
<line: 23> 13. 
<line: 24> The Defendant, PETER DiANGI, engaged in conduct against the Plaintiffs, which 
<line: 25> conduct included striking the Plaintiffs, grabbing the Plaintiffs, and spraying the Plaintiffs with 
<line: 26> pepper spray. 

[TITLE]
<line: 28> ANSWER: 
<line: 29> Defendant, Peter DiAngi, individually and as employee of Silver Lake Country 
<line: 30> Club, Inc., admits only that he defended himself from Plaintiffs’ attacks on him 
<line: 31> and was justified in his actions because he feared for his safety and life.  Further 
<line: 32> answering, Defendant denies the remainder of the allegations contained in 
<line: 33> Paragraph 13 of Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law. 

[TITLE]
<line: 35> COUNT I – BATTERY 

[TEXT]
<line: 37> (Andrew Terrell v. Peter DiAngi) 

[TEXT]
<line: 39> 1-13. Plaintiff adopts and realleges Paragraphs 1 – 13 inclusive of the COMMON 
<line: 40> FACTUAL ALLEGATIONS section as and for Paragraphs 1 -13 inclusive of Count I, as though 
<line: 41> fully set forth herein and incorporated the same by reference. 

[TEXT]
<line: 43> ANSWER: 
<line: 44> Defendant, Peter DiAngi, restates and realleges his answers contained in 
<line: 45> Paragraphs 1 through 13 of Count I of Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law as 
<line: 46> if set forth fully herein. 

[ABANDON]
<line: 48> 4

[ABANDON]
<line: 50> 504739.1 

[TITLE]
<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430     Document 28      Filed 07/18/2008     Page 5 of 34

[TEXT]
<line: 4> 14. 
<line: 5> The conduct and force used by PETER DiANGI toward the Plaintiff, ANDREW 
<line: 6> TERRELL, was intentional, malicious, excessive and in reckless disregard of the Plaintiffs’ 
<line: 7> constitutional rights.  Moreover, the use of force used against the Plaintiff was excessive. 

[TEXT]
<line: 9> ANSWER: 
<line: 10> Defendant, Peter DiAngi, denies the allegations contained in Paragraph 14 of 
<line: 11> Count I of Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law. 

[TEXT]
<line: 13> 15. 
<line: 14> As a result of the aforementioned conduct of the Defendants, the Plaintiff suffered 
<line: 15> serious physical injuries.  Plaintiff also incurred medical expenses and other damages, including 
<line: 16> physical and emotional pain and suffering. 

[TEXT]
<line: 18> ANSWER: 
<line: 19> Defendant, Peter DiAngi, individually and as employee of Silver Lake Country 
<line: 20> Club, Inc., denies the “aforementioned conduct” against Andrew Terrell.  Further 
<line: 21> answering, Peter DiAngi is without sufficient knowledge to form a belief as to the 
<line: 22> truth of the allegations contained in Paragraph 15 of Count I of Plaintiffs’ 
<line: 23> Amended Complaint at Law and hereby denies same. 

[TEXT]
<line: 25> 16. 
<line: 26> The Plaintiff’s injuries were the proximate result of Defendant’s aforementioned 
<line: 27> conduct. 

[TEXT]
<line: 29> ANSWER: 
<line: 30> Defendant, Peter DiAngi, individually and as employee of Silver Lake Country 
<line: 31> Club, Inc., denies the allegations contained in Paragraph 16 of Count I of 
<line: 32> Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law. 

[TEXT]
<line: 34> WHEREFORE, Defendant, Peter DiAngi, individually and as employee of Silver Lake 
<line: 35> Country Club, Inc., respectfully requests that this Court enter an order dismissing Plaintiffs’ 
<line: 36> Amended Complaint at Law with prejudice and without costs, and for any other relief that this 
<line: 37> Court deems just and appropriate.

<line: 6> Club, Inc.,  restates and realleges his answers contained in Paragraphs 1 through 
<line: 7> 13 of Count II of Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law as if set forth fully 
<line: 8> herein.  

[TEXT]
<line: 10> 14. 
<line: 11> The Defendants’ conduct placed Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, in apprehension 
<line: 12> of immediate and imminent harm to his well being and safety, and he suffered great shame and 
<line: 13> humiliation and injury to his dignity and feelings, upsetting her mentally, emotionally and 
<line: 14> psychologically. 

[TEXT]
<line: 16> ANSWER: 
<line: 17> Defendant, Peter DiAngi, individually and as employee of Silver Lake Country 
<line: 18> Club, Inc., denies the allegations contained in Paragraph 14 of Count II of 
<line: 19> Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law. 

[TEXT]
<line: 21> WHEREFORE, Defendant, Peter DiAngi, individually and as employee of Silver Lake 
<line: 22> Country Club, Inc., respectfully requests that this Court enter an order dismissing Plaintiffs’ 
<line: 23> Amended Complaint at Law with prejudice and without costs, and for any other relief that this 
<line: 24> Court deems just and appropriate. 

[TITLE]
<line: 26> COUNT III – NEGLIGENCE 

[TITLE]
<line: 28> (Andrew Terrell v. Peter DiAngi) 

[TEXT]
<line: 30> 1. 
<line: 31> At all times relevant herein, the Defendant, PETER DiANGI, was employed by 
<line: 32> the Defendant, SILVER LAKE, as a security guard. 

[TEXT]
<line: 34> ANSWER: 
<line: 35> Defendant, Peter DiAngi, admits that he was employed by Silver Lake Country 
<line: 36> Club during Andrew Terrell’s wedding reception at Silver Lake Country Club 
<line: 37> located at 14700 South 82nd Avenue in the City of Orland Park, County of Cook 
<line: 38> and State of Illinois.  Further answering, Defendant denies the remainder of the 
<line: 39> allegations contained in Paragraph 1 of Count III of Plaintiffs’ Amended 
<line: 40> Complaint at Law. 

[TEXT]
<line: 42> 2. 
<line: 43> At all times relevant herein, the Defendant, SILVER LAKE, was a duly licensed 
<line: 44> corporation, incorporated in the State of Illinois and doing business as Silver Lake Country Club 

[ABANDON]
<line: 46> 6

[ABANDON]
<line: 48> 504739.1 

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430     Document 28      Filed 07/18/2008     Page 7 of 34

[TEXT]
<line: 4> and located at 14700 South 82nd Avenue in the City of Orland Park, County of Cook, and State 
<line: 5> of Illinois. 

[TEXT]
<line: 7> ANSWER: 
<line: 8> Defendant, Peter DiAngi, individually and as employee of Silver Lake Country 
<line: 9> Club, Inc., has insufficient knowledge with which to form a belief as to the truth 
<line: 10> or falsity of the allegations contained in Paragraph 2 of Count III of Plaintiffs’ 
<line: 11> Amended Complaint at Law. 

[TEXT]
<line: 13> 3. 
<line: 14> On or about March 18, 2006, the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, and his fiancé 
<line: 15> were married at Queen of Martyrs Church in Evergreen Park. Immediately after the wedding 
<line: 16> ceremony, the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, his fiancé, and various other members of the 
<line: 17> wedding guests, including Plaintiff GEORGE TERRELL, attended a wedding reception at Silver 
<line: 18> Lake Country Club. 

[TEXT]
<line: 20> ANSWER: 
<line: 21> Defendant has insufficient knowledge with which to form a belief as to the truth 
<line: 22> or falsity of the allegations contained in Paragraph 3 of Count III of Plaintiffs’ 
<line: 23> Amended Complaint at Law, and, therefore, neither admits nor denies said 
<line: 24> allegations, but demands strict proof thereof. 

[TEXT]
<line: 26> 4. 
<line: 27> During the course of the reception, the Defendant, PETER DiANGI, was engaged 
<line: 28> in his ordinary duties as a security guard and was working in his capacity as employee or agent 
<line: 29> of the Defendant, SILVER LAKE. 

[TEXT]
<line: 31> ANSWER: 
<line: 32> Defendant, Peter DiAngi, individually and as employee of Silver Lake Country 
<line: 33> Club, Inc., admits that he was engaged in his employment as a security guard at 
<line: 34> Silver Lake during the reception.  Defendant denies the remainder of the 
<line: 35> allegations contained in Paragraph 4 of Count III of Plaintiffs’ Amended 
<line: 36> Complaint at Law Defendant. 

[TEXT]
<line: 38> 5. 
<line: 39> At all times relevant herein, the Defendant PETER DiANGI owed a duty of 
<line: 40> ordinary care to the Plaintiff while performing his tasks as a security officer. 

[TEXT]
<line: 42> ANSWER: 
<line: 43> Defendant, Peter DiAngi, individually and as employee of Silver Lake Country 
<line: 44> Club, Inc., admits to all duties imposed by law and denies any were breached. 

[TEXT]
<line: 46> 6. 
<line: 47> On March 18, 2006, the Defendant, PETER DiANGI, breached his aforesaid duty 
<line: 48> by engaging in one or more of the following negligent acts or omissions: 

[ABANDON]
<line: 50> 7

[ABANDON]
<line: 52> 504739.1 

[TITLE]
<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430     Document 28      Filed 07/18/2008     Page 8 of 34

[TEXT]
<line: 4> a. 
<line: 5> negligently failed to identify himself as a security guard or employee of 
<line: 6> Silver Lake; 
<line: 7> b. 
<line: 8> negligently pushed the Plaintiff; 
<line: 9> c. 
<line: 10> negligently sprayed the Plaintiff with pepper spray; 
<line: 11> d. 
<line: 12> negligently attempted to physically restrain the Plaintiff; and/or 
<line: 13> e. 
<line: 14> was otherwise negligent. 

[TEXT]
<line: 16> ANSWER: 
<line: 17> Defendant, Peter DiAngi, individually and as employee of Silver Lake Country 
<line: 18> Club, Inc., denies the allegations contained in Paragraph 6 a through e inclusive of 
<line: 19> Count III of Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law. 

[TEXT]
<line: 21> 7. 
<line: 22> As a result of the aforementioned conduct of the Defendants, the Plaintiff suffered 
<line: 23> serious physical injuries.  Plaintiff also incurred medical expenses and other damages, including 
<line: 24> physical and emotional pain and suffering. 

[TEXT]
<line: 26> ANSWER: 
<line: 27> Defendant, Peter DiAngi, individually and as employee of Silver Lake Country 
<line: 28> Club, Inc., denies he engaged in the “aforementioned conduct”.  Further 
<line: 29> answering, Defendant is without knowledge to form a belief as to the truth of the 
<line: 30> allegations contained in Paragraph 7 of Count III of Plaintiffs’ Amended 
<line: 31> Complaint at Law. 

[TEXT]
<line: 33> 8. 
<line: 34> The Plaintiff’s injuries were the proximate result of the Defendant’s 
<line: 35> aforementioned conduct. 

[TEXT]
<line: 37> ANSWER: 
<line: 38> Defendant, Peter DiAngi, individually and as employee of Silver Lake Country 
<line: 39> Club, Inc., denies the allegations contained in Paragraph 8 of Count III of 
<line: 40> Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law. 

[TEXT]
<line: 42> WHEREFORE, Defendant, PETER DiANGI, individually and as employee of Silver 
<line: 43> Lake Country Club, Inc., respectfully requests that this Court enter an order dismissing 
<line: 44> Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law with prejudice and without costs, and for any other relief 
<line: 45> that this Court deems just and appropriate.

[TEXT]

<line: 9> FACTUAL ALLEGATIONS section as and for Paragraphs 1 -13 inclusive of Count III, as 
<line: 10> though fully set forth herein and incorporated the same by reference. 

[TEXT]
<line: 12> ANSWER: 
<line: 13> Defendant, Silver Lake, restates and realleges its answers contained in Paragraphs 
<line: 14> 1 through 13 of Count III of Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law as if set forth 
<line: 15> fully herein. 

[TEXT]
<line: 17> 14. 
<line: 18> The conduct and force used by PETER DiANGI toward the Plaintiff, ANDREW 

[TEXT]
<line: 20> TERRELL, was intentional, malicious, excessive and in reckless disregard of the Plaintiffs’ 
<line: 21> constitutional rights.  Moreover, the use of force used against the Plaintiff was excessive. 

[TEXT]
<line: 23> ANSWER: 
<line: 24> Defendant, Silver Lake, denies the allegations contained in Paragraph 14 of Count 
<line: 25> IV of Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law. 

[TEXT]
<line: 27> 15. 
<line: 28> At all times relevant herein the Defendant, PETER DiANGI, was engaged in his 
<line: 29> ordinary duties as a security guard and was working in his capacity as employee or agent of the 
<line: 30> Defendant, SILVER LAKE. 

[TEXT]
<line: 32> ANSWER: 
<line: 33> Defendant, Silver Lake admits that Peter DiAngi was engaged in his duties as a 
<line: 34> security guard and employee of Silver Lake Country Club on the date of the 
<line: 35> reception described in Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law.  Further answering, 
<line: 36> Defendant denies the remainder of the allegations contained in Paragraph 15 of 
<line: 37> Count IV of Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law. 

[TEXT]
<line: 39> 16. 
<line: 40> At all times set forth in paragraph 1 – 13, PETER DiANGI, knew that the 

[TEXT]
<line: 42> Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, was legally upon the premises of Silver Lake Country Club. 

[TEXT]
<line: 44> ANSWER: 
<line: 45> Defendant, Silver Lake, is without sufficient knowledge to form a belief as to the 
<line: 46> truth of the allegations contained in Paragraph 16 of Count IV of Plaintiffs’ 
<line: 47> Amended Complaint. 

[ABANDON]
<line: 49> 9

[ABANDON]
<line: 51> 504739.1 

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430     Document 28      Filed 07/18/2008     Page 10 of 34

[TEXT]
<line: 4> 17. 
<line: 5> The Defendant’s conduct in striking the Plaintiff and spraying the Plaintiff with 
<line: 6> mace was unjustified and excessive. 

[TEXT]
<line: 8> ANSWER: 
<line: 9> Defendant, Silver Lake, denies the allegations contained in Paragraph 17 of Count 
<line: 10> IV of Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law. 

[TEXT]
<line: 12> 18. 
<line: 13> As a result of the aforementioned conduct of the Defendants, the Plaintiff suffered 
<line: 14> serious injuries.  Plaintiff also incurred medical expenses and other damage, including physical 
<line: 15> and emotional pain and suffering. 

[TEXT]
<line: 17> ANSWER: 
<line: 18> Defendant, Silver Lake, denies it or Peter DiAngi engaged in the “aforementioned 
<line: 19> conduct”.  Further answering, Defendant is without sufficient knowledge to form 
<line: 20> a belief as to the truth of the allegations contained in Paragraph 18 of Count IV of 
<line: 21> Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint. 

[TEXT]
<line: 23> 19. 
<line: 24> The Plaintiff’s injuries were the proximate result of Defendant’s aforementioned 
<line: 25> conduct. 

[TEXT]
<line: 27> ANSWER: 
<line: 28> Defendant, Silver Lake, denies the allegations contained in Paragraph 19 of Count 
<line: 29> IV of Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law. 

[TEXT]
<line: 31> 20. 
<line: 32> The Defendant, SILVER LAKE, is vicariously liable for the actions and conduct 
<line: 33> of PETER DiANGI. 

[TEXT]
<line: 35> ANSWER: 
<line: 36> Defendant makes no answer to this allegation as it seeks a legal conclusion of law 
<line: 37> and leaves all questions of law to the Court. 

[TEXT]
<line: 39> WHEREFORE, Defendant, SILVER LAKE, respectfully requests that this Court enter 
<line: 40> an order dismissing Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law with prejudice and without costs, and 
<line: 41> for any other relief that this Court deems just and appropriate. 

[TITLE]
<line: 43> COUNT V – ASSAULT 

[TEXT]
<line: 45> (Andrew Terrell v. Silver Lake) 

[ABANDON]

<line: 5> FACTUAL ALLEGATIONS section as and for Paragraphs 1 -13 inclusive of Count IV, as 
<line: 6> though fully set forth herein and incorporated the same by reference. 

[TEXT]
<line: 8> ANSWER: 
<line: 9> Defendant, Silver Lake, restates and realleges its answers contained in Paragraphs 
<line: 10> 1 through 13 of Count IV of Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law as if set forth 
<line: 11> fully herein. 

[TEXT]
<line: 13> 14. 
<line: 14> The conduct of Defendant, SILVER LAKE, by and through its employee and 
<line: 15> agent, PETER DiANGI, placed Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, in apprehension of immediate 
<line: 16> and imminent harm to his well being and safety, and he suffered great shame and humiliation 
<line: 17> and injury to his dignity and feelings, upsetting them mentally, emotionally and psychologically. 

[TEXT]
<line: 19> ANSWER: 
<line: 20> Defendant, Silver Lake, denies the allegations contained in Paragraph 14 of Count 
<line: 21> V of Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law. 

[TEXT]
<line: 23> WHEREFORE, Defendant, SILVER LAKE, respectfully requests that this Court enter 
<line: 24> an order dismissing Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law with prejudice and without costs, and 
<line: 25> for any other relief that this Court deems just and appropriate. 

[TITLE]
<line: 27> COUNT VI  - NEGLIGENCE 

[TITLE]
<line: 29> (Andrew Terrell v. Silver Lake) 

[TEXT]
<line: 31> 1. 
<line: 32> At all times relevant herein, the Defendant, SILVER LAKE, was a duly licensed 
<line: 33> corporation, incorporated in the State of Illinois and doing business as Silver Lake Country Club 
<line: 34> and located at 14700 South 82nd Avenue in the City of Orland Park, County of Cook, and State 
<line: 35> of Illinois. 

[TEXT]
<line: 37> ANSWER: 
<line: 38> Defendant, Silver Lake, admits that it was a duly licensed corporation 
<line: 39> incorporated in the State of Illinois and doing business as Silver Lake Country 
<line: 40> Club and located at 14700 South 82nd Avenue in the City of Orland Park, County 
<line: 41> of Cook, and State of Illinois during Andrew Terrell’s wedding reception on 
<line: 42> March 18, 2006 in the evening. 

[ABANDON]
<line: 44> 11

[ABANDON]
<line: 46> 504739.1 

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430     Document 28      Filed 07/18/2008     Page 12 of 34

[TEXT]
<line: 4> 2. 
<line: 5> Prior to March 18, 2006, the Defendant, SILVER LAKE, hired and employed the 

[TEXT]
<line: 7> Defendant PETER DiANGI, as a security guard at the Silver Lake Country Club. 

[TEXT]
<line: 9> ANSWER: 
<line: 10> Defendant, Silver Lake, admits that Peter DiAngi was working as a security guard 
<line: 11> and performing his duties as an employee of Silver Lake Country Club on and 
<line: 12> before March 18, 2006.   

[TEXT]
<line: 14> 3. 
<line: 15> On or about March 18, 2006, the Defendant, PETER DiANGI, was working as a 
<line: 16> security guard and performing his ordinary duties as an employee or agent of the Defendant, 
<line: 17> SILVER LAKE. 

[TEXT]
<line: 19> ANSWER: 
<line: 20> Defendant, Silver Lake, admits that Peter DiAngi on or about March 18, 2006 was 
<line: 21> working and performing his duties as a security guard and employee of 
<line: 22> Defendant, Silver Lake.  Further answering, Defendant denies the remainder of 
<line: 23> the allegations contained in Paragraph 3 of Count VI of Plaintiffs’ Amended 
<line: 24> Complaint at Law and hereby denies same. 

[TEXT]
<line: 26> 4. 
<line: 27> On or about March 18, 2006, the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, and his fiancé 
<line: 28> were married at Queen of Martyrs Church in Evergreen Park. Immediately after the wedding 
<line: 29> ceremony, the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, his fiancé, and various other members of the 
<line: 30> wedding guests, including Plaintiff GEORGE TERRELL, attended a wedding reception at Silver 
<line: 31> Lake Country Club. 

[TEXT]
<line: 33> ANSWER: 
<line: 34> Defendant has insufficient knowledge with which to form a belief as to the truth 
<line: 35> or falsity of the allegations contained in Paragraph 4 of Count VI of Plaintiffs’ 
<line: 36> Amended Complaint at Law, and, therefore, neither admits nor denies said 
<line: 37> allegations, but demands strict proof thereof. 

[TEXT]
<line: 39> 5. 
<line: 40> During the course of the reception, the Defendant, PETER DiANGI, was engaged 
<line: 41> in his ordinary duties as a security guard and was working in his capacity as employee or agent 
<line: 42> of the Defendant, SILVER LAKE. 

[TITLE]
<line: 44> ANSWER: 
<line: 45> Defendant, Silver Lake, admits that Peter DiAngi was engaged in his duties as a 
<line: 46> security guard and working in his capacity as an employee of Defendant, Silver 
<line: 47> Lake, on March 18, 2006 and at the time of the reception.  Further answering, 
<line: 48> Defendant denies the remainder of the allegations contained in Paragraph 5 of 
<line: 49> Count VI of Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law. 

[ABANDON]
<line: 51> 12

[ABANDON]
<line: 53> 504739.1 

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430     Document 28      Filed 07/18/2008     Page 13 of 34

[TEXT]
<line: 4> 6. 
<line: 5> At all times relevant herein, the Defendant, SILVER LAKE, through its 
<line: 6> employees and agents, including PETER DiANGI, owed duties of ordinary care to the Plaintiff 
<line: 7> to hire well-qualified security personnel, and to ensure that the security acted appropriately when 
<line: 8> providing security. 

[TEXT]
<line: 10> ANSWER: 
<line: 11> Defendant, Silver Lake, admits to all duties imposed by law and denies any were 
<line: 12> breached by it or its employees on March 18, 2006.  Further answering, 
<line: 13> Defendant denies the remainder of the allegations contained in Paragraph 6 of 
<line: 14> Count VI of Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law. 

[TEXT]
<line: 16> 7. 
<line: 17> On March 18, 2006, the Defendant, SILVER LAKE, through its employees 
<line: 18> and/or agents, including the Defendant, PETER DiANGI, breached its aforesaid duties to the 
<line: 19> Plaintiff by engaging in one or more of the following negligent acts or omissions: 

[TEXT]
<line: 21> a. 
<line: 22> negligently failed to properly train the Defendant, PETER DiANGI, as a 
<line: 23> security guard responsible for providing security to patron during social 
<line: 24> events at SILVER LAKE; 
<line: 25> b. 
<line: 26> negligently failed to adequately supervise the Defendant, PETER 
<line: 27> DiANGI, during the performance of his duties as a security guard; 
<line: 28> c. 
<line: 29> negligently permitted the Defendant, PETER DiANGI, to work as a 
<line: 30> security guard without sufficient assistance or supervision; 
<line: 31> d. 
<line: 32> negligently failed to provide adequate security personnel to assist the 
<line: 33> Defendant, PETER DiANGI, in providing security; 
<line: 34> e. 
<line: 35> negligently hired the Defendant, PETER DiANGI, as a security officer. 

[TEXT]
<line: 37> ANSWER: 
<line: 38> Defendant, Silver Lake, denies the allegations contained in Paragraph 7 of Count 
<line: 39> VI of Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law 

[TEXT]
<line: 41> 8. 
<line: 42> In addition to the aforesaid negligent acts and/or omissions, the Defendant, 
<line: 43> SILVER LAKE, is vicariously liable for the negligent acts and/or omissions of the Defendant, 
<line: 44> PETER DiANGI, as alleged in Count III above. 

[TEXT]
<line: 46> ANSWER: 
<line: 47> Defendant, Silver Lake, makes no answer to the allegations contained in 
<line: 48> Paragraph 8 of Count VI of Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law as it states a 

[ABANDON]
<line: 50> 13

[ABANDON]
<line: 52> 504739.1 

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430     Document 28      Filed 07/18/2008     Page 14 of 34

[TEXT]
<line: 4> legal conclusion and leaves all questions of law to the Court.  Further answering, 
<line: 5> to the extent any of the allegations are beyond a legal conclusion they are denied. 

[TEXT]
<line: 7> 9. 
<line: 8> As a result of the aforementioned conduct of the Defendant, the Plaintiff suffered 
<line: 9> serious physical injuries.  Plaintiff also incurred medical expenses and other damages, including 
<line: 10> physical and emotional pain and suffering. 

[TEXT]
<line: 12> ANSWER: 
<line: 13> Defendant, Silver Lake, denies that it or Peter DiAngi engaged in the 
<line: 14> “aforementioned conduct”.  Further answering, Defendant, Silver Lake, is without 
<line: 15> sufficient knowledge to form a belief as to the truth of the allegations contained in 
<line: 16> Paragraph 9 of Count VI of Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law and hereby 
<line: 17> denies same. 

[TEXT]
<line: 19> 10. 
<line: 20> The Plaintiff’s injuries were the proximate result of the Defendant’s 
<line: 21> aforementioned conduct. 

[TEXT]
<line: 23> ANSWER: 
<line: 24> Defendant, Silver Lake, denies the allegations contained in Paragraph 10 of Count 
<line: 25> VI of Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law. 

[TEXT]
<line: 27> WHEREFORE, Defendant, SILVER LAKE, respectfully requests that this Court enter 
<line: 28> an order dismissing Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law with prejudice and without costs, and 
<line: 29> for any other relief that this Court deems just and appropriate.

[TEXT]

<line: 15> forth fully herein. 

[TEXT]
<line: 17> 14. 
<line: 18> The conduct of Defendant, SILVER LAKE, by and through its employee and 
<line: 19> agent, PETER DiANGI, placed Plaintiff, GEORGE TERRELL, in apprehension of immediate 
<line: 20> and imminent harm to his well being and safety, and he suffered great shame and humiliation 
<line: 21> and injury to his dignity and feelings, upsetting them mentally, emotionally and psychologically. 

[TEXT]
<line: 23> ANSWER: 
<line: 24> Defendant, Silver Lake, denies the allegations contained in Paragraph 14 of Count 
<line: 25> XVI of Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law. 

[TEXT]
<line: 27> WHEREFORE, Defendant, SILVER LAKE, respectfully requests that this Court enter 
<line: 28> an order dismissing Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law with prejudice and without costs, and 
<line: 29> for any other relief that this Court deems just and appropriate. 

[TITLE]
<line: 31> COUNT XVII  - NEGLIGENCE 

[TITLE]
<line: 33> (Andrew Terrell v. Silver Lake) 

[TEXT]
<line: 35> 1. 
<line: 36> At all times relevant herein, the Defendant, SILVER LAKE, was a duly licensed 
<line: 37> corporation, incorporated in the State of Illinois and doing business as Silver Lake Country Club 
<line: 38> and located at 14700 South 82nd Avenue in the City of Orland Park, County of Cook, and State 
<line: 39> of Illinois. 

[ABANDON]
<line: 41> 22

[ABANDON]
<line: 43> 504739.1 

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430     Document 28      Filed 07/18/2008     Page 23 of 34

[TEXT]
<line: 4> ANSWER: 
<line: 5> Defendant, Silver Lake, admits that it was a duly licensed corporation 
<line: 6> incorporated in the State of Illinois and doing business as Silver Lake Country 
<line: 7> Club and located at 14700 South 82nd Avenue in the City of Orland Park, County 
<line: 8> of Cook, and State of Illinois during Andrew Terrell’s wedding reception on 
<line: 9> March 18, 2006 in the evening.  

[TEXT]
<line: 11> 2. 
<line: 12> Prior to March 18, 2006, the Defendant, SILVER LAKE, hired and employed the 

[TEXT]
<line: 14> Defendant PETER DiANGI, as a security guard at the Silver Lake Country Club. 

[TEXT]
<line: 16> ANSWER: 
<line: 17> Defendant, Silver Lake, admits that Peter DiAngi was working as a security guard 
<line: 18> and performing his ordinary duties as an employee of Silver Lake Country club 
<line: 19> on or about March 18, 2006.   

[TEXT]
<line: 21> 3. 
<line: 22> On or about March 18, 2006, the Defendant, PETER DiANGI, was working as a 
<line: 23> security guard and performing his ordinary duties as an employee or agent of the Defendant, 
<line: 24> SILVER LAKE. 

[TEXT]
<line: 26> ANSWER: 
<line: 27> Defendant, Silver Lake, admits that Peter DiAngi on or about March 18, 2006 was 
<line: 28> working and performing his duties as a security guard and employee of 
<line: 29> Defendant, Silver Lake.  Further answering, Defendant denies the remainder of 
<line: 30> the allegations contained in Paragraph 3 of Count XVII of Plaintiffs’ Amended 
<line: 31> Complaint at Law. 

[TEXT]
<line: 33> 4. 
<line: 34> On or about March 18, 2006, the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, and his fiancé 
<line: 35> were married at Queen of Martyrs Church in Evergreen Park. Immediately after the wedding 
<line: 36> ceremony, the Plaintiff, ANDREW TERRELL, his fiancé, and various other members of the 
<line: 37> wedding guests, including Plaintiff GEORGE TERRELL, attended a wedding reception at Silver 
<line: 38> Lake Country Club. 

[TEXT]
<line: 40> ANSWER: 
<line: 41> Defendant has insufficient knowledge with which to form a belief as to the truth 
<line: 42> of falsity of the allegations contained in Paragraph 4 of Count XVII of Plaintiffs’ 
<line: 43> Amended Complaint at Law and therefore neither admits nor denies said 
<line: 44> allegations, but demands strict proof thereof.  

[TEXT]
<line: 46> 5. 
<line: 47> During the course of the reception, the Defendant, PETER DiANGI, was engaged 
<line: 48> in his ordinary duties as a security guard and was working in his capacity as employee or agent 
<line: 49> of the Defendant, SILVER LAKE. 

[ABANDON]
<line: 51> 23

[ABANDON]
<line: 53> 504739.1 

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430     Document 28      Filed 07/18/2008     Page 24 of 34

[TEXT]
<line: 4> ANSWER: 
<line: 5> Defendant, Silver Lake, admits that Peter DiAngi was engaged in his duties as a 
<line: 6> security guard and working in his capacity as an employee of Defendant, Silver 
<line: 7> Lake, on March 18, 2006 and at the time of the reception.  Further answering, 
<line: 8> Defendant denies the remainder of the allegations contained in Paragraph 5 or 
<line: 9> Count XVII of Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law. 

[TEXT]
<line: 11> 6. 
<line: 12> At all times relevant herein, the Defendant, SILVER LAKE, through its 
<line: 13> employees and agents, including PETER DiANGI, owed duties of ordinary care to the Plaintiff 
<line: 14> to hire well-qualified security personnel, and to ensure that the security acted appropriately when 
<line: 15> providing security. 

[TEXT]
<line: 17> ANSWER: 
<line: 18> Defendant, Silver Lake, admits to all duties imposed by law and denies any were 
<line: 19> breached by it or its employees on March 18, 2006.  Further answering, 
<line: 20> Defendant denies the remainder of the allegations contained in Paragraph 6 of 
<line: 21> Count XVII of Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law. 

[TEXT]
<line: 23> 7. 
<line: 24> On March 18, 2006, the Defendant, SILVER LAKE, through its employees 
<line: 25> and/or agents, including the Defendant, PETER DiANGI, breached its aforesaid duties to the 
<line: 26> Plaintiff by engaging in one or more of the following negligent acts or omissions: 

[TEXT]
<line: 28> a. 
<line: 29> negligently failed to properly train the Defendant, PETER DiANGI, as a 
<line: 30> security guard responsible for providing security to patron during social 
<line: 31> events at SILVER LAKE; 
<line: 32> b. 
<line: 33> negligently failed to adequately supervise the Defendant, PETER 
<line: 34> DiANGI, during the performance of his duties as a security guard; 
<line: 35> c. 
<line: 36> negligently permitted the Defendant, PETER DiANGI, to work as a 
<line: 37> security guard without sufficient assistance or supervision; 
<line: 38> d. 
<line: 39> negligently failed to provide adequate security personnel to assist the 
<line: 40> Defendant, PETER DiANGI, in providing security; 
<line: 41> e. 
<line: 42> negligently hired the Defendant, PETER DiANGI, as a security officer. 

[TEXT]
<line: 44> ANSWER: 
<line: 45> Defendant, Silver Lake, denies the allegations contained in Paragraph 7 a through 
<line: 46> e inclusive of Count XVII of Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law 

[ABANDON]
<line: 48> 24

[ABANDON]
<line: 50> 504739.1 

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430     Document 28      Filed 07/18/2008     Page 25 of 34

[TEXT]
<line: 4> 8. 
<line: 5> In addition to the aforesaid negligent acts and/or omissions, the Defendant, 
<line: 6> SILVER LAKE, is vicariously liable for the negligent acts and/or omissions of the Defendant, 
<line: 7> PETER DiANGI, as alleged in Count XIV above. 

[TEXT]
<line: 9> ANSWER: 
<line: 10> Defendant, Silver Lake, makes no answer to the allegations contained in 
<line: 11> paragraph 8 of Count XVII of Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law as it states a 
<line: 12> legal conclusion and leaves all questions of law to the Court.  Further answering, 
<line: 13> to the extent any of the allegations are beyond a legal conclusion they are denied. 

[TEXT]
<line: 15> 9. 
<line: 16> As a result of the aforementioned conduct of the Defendant, the Plaintiff suffered 
<line: 17> serious physical injuries.  Plaintiff also incurred medical expenses and other damages, including 
<line: 18> physical and emotional pain and suffering. 

[TEXT]
<line: 20> ANSWER: 
<line: 21> Defendant, Silver Lake, denies it engaged in the “aforementioned conduct”.  
<line: 22> Further answering, Silver Lake is without sufficient knowledge to form a belief as 
<line: 23> to the truth of the allegations contained in Paragraph 9 of Count XVII of 
<line: 24> Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law and hereby denies same. 

[TEXT]
<line: 26> 10. 
<line: 27> The Plaintiff’s injuries were the proximate result of the Defendant’s 
<line: 28> aforementioned conduct. 

[TEXT]
<line: 30> ANSWER: 
<line: 31> Defendant, Silver Lake, denies the allegations contained in Paragraph 10 of Count 
<line: 32> XVII of Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law. 

[TEXT]
<line: 34> WHEREFORE, Defendant, SILVER LAKE, respectfully requests that this Court enter 
<line: 35> an order dismissing Plaintiffs’ Amended Complaint at Law with prejudice and without costs, and 
<line: 36> for any other relief that this Court deems just and appropriate.

<line: 45> these Defendants, they are specifically denied.

[TITLE]
<line: 12> COUNTERCLAIM AGAINST ANDREW TERRELL AND GEORGE TERRELL 

[TITLE]
<line: 14> JURISDICTION  

[TEXT]
<line: 16> 1.  
<line: 17> The jurisdiction of this Court is invoked pursuant to the Civil Rights Act, 42  
<line: 18> U.S.C. § 1983, the Judicial Code, 28 U.S.C. §1331 and the Constitution of the United States. 

[TITLE]
<line: 20> COMMON FACTUAL ALLEGATIONS 

[TEXT]
<line: 22> 1. 
<line: 23> On March 18, 2006 Counter-Defendants, Andrew Terrell and George Terrell were 
<line: 24> residents of Cook County, State of Illinois. 

[TEXT]
<line: 26> 2. 
<line: 27> On March 18, 2006 Jason Terrell was a resident of Will County, State of Illinois. 
<line: 28> 3. 
<line: 29> On March 18, 2006, Counter-Plaintiff, Peter DiAngi was a resident of Cook 
<line: 30> County, State of Illinois. 

[TEXT]
<line: 32> 4. 
<line: 33> On March 18, 2006 Counter-Plaintiff, Peter DiAngi was employed by Silver Lake 
<line: 34> Country Club as a security guard. 

[TEXT]
<line: 36> 5. 
<line: 37> On March 18, 2006 Counter-Defendant, Andrew Terrell along with his fiancé and 
<line: 38> relatives, including George Terrell and Jason Terrell attended a wedding reception at Silver Lake 
<line: 39> Country Club. 

[ABANDON]
<line: 41> 27

[ABANDON]
<line: 43> 504739.1 

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430     Document 28      Filed 07/18/2008     Page 28 of 34

[TEXT]
<line: 4> 6. 
<line: 5> On March 18, 2006 Counter-Plaintiff, Peter DiAngi, confronted Jason Terrell 
<line: 6> after he witnessed him giving an alcoholic beverage to members of the reception who were not 
<line: 7> of legal age to consume alcohol and after learning that Jason Terrell, among others, were 
<line: 8> engaging in disorderly conduct by entering and urinating in the woman’s bathroom at said 
<line: 9> wedding reception. 

[TEXT]
<line: 11> 7. 
<line: 12> Counter-Plaintiff, Peter DiAngi attempted to gain Third-Party Defendant, Jason 
<line: 13> Terrell’s attention by placing his hand on Mr. Terrell’s arm. 

[TEXT]
<line: 15> 8. 
<line: 16> Jason Terrell therein shoved Peter DiAngi against the wall and began striking him 
<line: 17> about the face and body.   

[TEXT]
<line: 19> 9. 
<line: 20> Counter-Defendants therein began assisting and aiding Jason Terrell in punching, 
<line: 21> kicking and striking Peter DiAngi about the head and body. 

[TITLE]
<line: 23> COUNT I – BATTERY  

[TITLE]
<line: 25> (Peter DiAngi v. Andrew Terrell) 

[TEXT]
<line: 27> 1-9. 
<line: 28> Counter-Plaintiff, Peter DiAngi, adopts and realleges Paragraph 1 – 9 inclusive of 
<line: 29> the COMMON FACTUAL ALLEGATIONS section as and for Paragraphs 1 – 9 inclusive of 
<line: 30> Count I, as though fully set forth herein and incorporated by reference. 

[TEXT]
<line: 32> 10. 
<line: 33> The conduct and force used by Counter-Defendant, Andrew Terrell, towards Peter 
<line: 34> DiAngi was intentional, malicious, reckless and without justification. 

[TEXT]
<line: 36> 11. 
<line: 37> On March 18, 2006, Peter DiAngi was engaged in his duties as a security guard 
<line: 38> and employee of Silver Lake Country Club. 

[TEXT]
<line: 40> 12. 
<line: 41> Counter-Defendant, Andrew Terrell knew or should have known Peter DiAngi 
<line: 42> was an employee and acting in said scope of his employment for Silver Lake Country Club. 

[ABANDON]
<line: 44> 28

[ABANDON]
<line: 46> 504739.1 

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 1:08-cv-02430     Document 28      Filed 07/18/2008     Page 29 of 34

[TEXT]
<line: 4> 13. 
<line: 5> Counter-Defendant, Andrew Terrell’s conduct in striking Peter DiAngi was 
<line: 6> unjustified.   

[TEXT]
<line: 8> 14. 
<line: 9> As a result of Counter-Defendant, Andrew Terrell’s conduct Peter DiAngi 
<line: 10> suffered serious injuries. 

[TEXT]
<line: 12> 15. 
<line: 13> As a result of Counter-Defendant, Andrew Terrell’s conduct Peter DiAngi 
<line: 14> incurred medical expenses and other damages including physical and emotional pain and 
<line: 15> suffering. 

[TEXT]
<line: 17> 16. 
<line: 18> Peter DiAngi’s injuries were the proximate result of the Counter-Defendant, 
<line: 19> Andrew Terrell’s actions and conduct. 

[TEXT]
<line: 21> WHEREFORE, the Counter-Plaintiff, PETER DiANGI, respectfully requests judgment 
<line: 22> against the Counter-Defendant, ANDREW TERRELL, in a sum in excess of FIFTY 
<line: 23> THOUSAND AND 00/100 DOLLARS ($50,000.00) and such other relief as the Court deems 
<line: 24> just and proper.

<line: 32> 16 inclusive of Count II, as though fully set forth herein and incorporated by reference. 

[TEXT]
<line: 34> 17.

<line: 36> apprehension of immediate and imminent harm to his wellbeing and safety, and he suffered great 
<line: 37> shame and humiliation and injury to his dignity and feelings, upsetting him mentally, 
<line: 38> emotionally and psychologically.

<line: 6> State of Illinois.

<line: 9> On March 18, 2006 Third-Party Plaintiff, Peter DiAngi, was employed by Silver 
<line: 10> Lake Country Club as a security guard. 

[TEXT]
<line: 12> 4. 
<line: 13> On March 18, 2006 Andrew Terrell along with his fiancé were married and after 
<line: 14> the wedding ceremony, He, George Terrell and Jason Terrell, along with various other wedding 
<line: 15> guests, attended a wedding reception at Silver Lake Country Club. 

[TEXT]
<line: 17> 5. 
<line: 18> On March 18, 2006 Third-Party Plaintiff, Peter DiAngi, confronted Jason Terrell 
<line: 19> after he witnessed him giving an alcoholic beverage to members of the reception who were not 
<line: 20> of legal age to consume alcohol and after learning that Jason Terrell, among others, were

<line: 30> about the face and body.

<line: 34> punching, kicking and striking Peter DiAngi about the head and body.
